book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali: Pledging is according to what is contained in it, if the value of the pledge equals the debt, they are equal. If its value is more, the pledge is as stated and the creditor is trustworthy regarding the excess. If its value is less, the creditor returns with the excess of the debt over the value.

book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali: There is no liability on a borrower nor on a depositary except if they violate the agreement, and there is no liability on one who shares in profit. The depositor may deposit the deposit with his wife, child, servant, or worker. Also, Zaid ibn Ali said: The pledged property is not to be benefited from by the creditor. If the pledged property bears offspring, the offspring becomes pledged along with the pledge to the pledger. Similarly, fruit from a date-palm is pledged. Pledging is not valid except when taken into possession, because Allah the Mighty and Majestic says: So take a bond (pledge) from them.

book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali: No gift nor charity is valid except when specified, divided, and taken into possession, except for a charity that a person has obligated upon himself. In that case, it is obligatory for him to fulfill it sincerely for Allah the Exalted as he obligated upon himself.

book_name_ar: كتاب الفقه المنسوب لزيد بن علي
book_name_en: Fiqh Book attributed to Zaid ibn Ali
english_translation: Narrated from Ali: Whoever gives a gift to Allah, he may return in it as long as he has not been compensated for it. Every gift to Allah the Exalted and every charity, the giver may not return in it. Zaid ibn Ali said: Among gifts to Allah the Exalted is giving gifts to close relatives.
